vulnerabilities.title: Resource Exhaustion
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Resource Exhaustion by processing JSON Web Encryption (JWE) tokens with a high compression ratio. An attacker can cause excessive memory allocation and processing time during decompression, leading to a denial-of-service condition. This is only exploitable if the attacker has access to the public encrypt key registered with the IDP (Entra ID).
## Remediation
Upgrade `Microsoft.IdentityModel.JsonWebTokens` to version 5.7.0, 6.34.0, 7.1.2 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/AzureAD/azure-activedirectory-identitymodel-extensions-for-dotnet/releases/tag/5.7.0)
- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/AzureAD/azure-activedirectory-identitymodel-extensions-for-dotnet/releases/tag/6.34.0)
- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/AzureAD/azure-activedirectory-identitymodel-extensions-for-dotnet/releases/tag/7.1.2)
- [GitHub Wiki](https://github.com/AzureAD/azure-activedirectory-identitymodel-extensions-for-dotnet/wiki/zipcve)
vulnerabilities.name: Microsoft.IdentityModel.JsonWebTokens

vulnerabilities.title: Server-side Request Forgery (SSRF)
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Server-side Request Forgery (SSRF) via the `?url` parameter, which was intended to allow displaying remote OpenAPI definitions. This functionality may pose a risk for users who host their own SwaggerUI instances. In particular, including remote OpenAPI definitions opens a vector for phishing attacks by abusing the trusted names/domains of self-hosted instances.

**NOTE:** This vulnerability has also been identified as: [CVE-2021-46708](https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-DOTNET-SWASHBUCKLEASPNETCORESWAGGERUI-6056391)

## Remediation
Upgrade `Swashbuckle.AspNetCore.SwaggerUI` to version 6.3 or higher.
## References
- [Blog Post](https://www.vidocsecurity.com/blog/hacking-swagger-ui-from-xss-to-account-takeovers/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/domaindrivendev/Swashbuckle.AspNetCore/commit/401c7cb81e5efe835ceb8aae23e82057d57c7d29)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-ui/commit/01a3e55960f864a0acf6a8d06e5ddaf6776a7f76)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-ui/issues/4872)
- [Exploit DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/51379)
- [Nuclei Templates](https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/blob/main/headless/cves/2018/CVE-2018-25031.yaml)
vulnerabilities.name: Swashbuckle.AspNetCore.SwaggerUI

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure

insights.triageAdvice: This vulnerability is only applicable on applications that communicate with Microsoft SQL Server.

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Information Exposure. When a timeout occurs under a high load, it can cause incorrect data to be returned as the result of an asynchronously executed query.

**Notes:**

1) This vulnerability only affects applications that communicate with Microsoft SQL Server.

2) Exploiting this vulnerability requires an attacker to be within the SQL Connection Pool.
## Remediation
Upgrade `System.Data.SqlClient` to version 4.8.5 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/78042)
- [Microsoft Advisory](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2022-41064)
vulnerabilities.name: System.Data.SqlClient

vulnerabilities.title: Unprotected Storage of Credentials
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Unprotected Storage of Credentials. An attacker can steal authentication credentials intended for the database server by performing an adversary-in-the-middle attack between the SQL client and the SQL server, even if the connection is established over an encrypted channel like TLS.
## Remediation
Upgrade `System.Data.SqlClient` to version 4.8.6 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/dotnet/SqlClient/commit/4deb800c9534992d80573bcdb39439bece4ce0d5)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2255384)
- [Release Notes](https://github.com/dotnet/SqlClient/blob/2e4d1b69793e7ca3d7d9f2bc85206b933808ef3c/release-notes/2.1/2.1.7.md?plain=1#L9)
- [Release Notes](https://github.com/dotnet/SqlClient/blob/2e4d1b69793e7ca3d7d9f2bc85206b933808ef3c/release-notes/3.1/3.1.5.md?plain=1#L9)
- [Release Notes](https://github.com/dotnet/SqlClient/blob/2e4d1b69793e7ca3d7d9f2bc85206b933808ef3c/release-notes/4.0/4.0.5.md?plain=1#L9)
- [Release Notes](https://github.com/dotnet/SqlClient/blob/2e4d1b69793e7ca3d7d9f2bc85206b933808ef3c/release-notes/5.1/5.1.3.md?plain=1#L9)
vulnerabilities.name: System.Data.SqlClient

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Exhaustion
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Resource Exhaustion by processing JSON Web Encryption (JWE) tokens with a high compression ratio. An attacker can cause excessive memory allocation and processing time during decompression, leading to a denial-of-service condition. This is only exploitable if the attacker has access to the public encrypt key registered with the IDP (Entra ID).
## Remediation
Upgrade `System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Jwt` to version 5.7.0, 6.34.0, 7.1.2 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/AzureAD/azure-activedirectory-identitymodel-extensions-for-dotnet/releases/tag/5.7.0)
